title: Edmund Majowski
text:
Edmund Majowski (12 November 1910 – 26 October 1982) was a Polish <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and coach.
Playing career.
Majowski, who played as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a>, spent his professional career in both Poland and Austria, playing for <a href="AKS%20Chorz%C3%B3w">AKS Chorzów</a>, <a href="Pogo%C5%84%20Lw%C3%B3w">Pogoń Lwów</a> and <a href="VfB%20Admira%20Wacker%20M%C3%B6dling">Admira Vienna</a>.
Majowski also represented <a href="Poland%20national%20football%20team">Poland</a> at international level, scoring one goal in four games between 1933 and 1934.
Coaching career.
Majowski managed the <a href="Norway%20national%20football%20team">Norwegian national team</a> between 1957 and 1958.
